articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a drone strike on the Ukrainian capital Kyiv early on Wednesday, killing one person, wounding six others and damaging buildings in two districts, city officials said.
articles.title: One killed in Russian drone strike on Kyiv, officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un and his daughter Ju Ae attended New Year's celebrations including fireworks and an ice dancing display, state media KCNA reported on Wednesday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un attends New Year's celebrations with daughter, KCNA reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The next round of nuclear talks between Iran and three European countries will take place on Jan. 13 in Geneva, Iran's semi-official ISNA news agency cited the country's Deputy Foreign Minister Kazem Gharibabadi as saying on Wednesday.
articles.title: Next nuclear talks between Iran and three European countries due on Jan 13

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Romania and Bulgaria scrapped land border controls to become full members of the European Union's Schengen free-travel area on Wednesday, joining an expanded bloc of countries whose residents can travel without passport checks.
articles.title: Romania, Bulgaria fully join EU's borderless Schengen zone

articles.author: Vladimir Soldatkin, Dan Peleschuk
articles.description: Russian natural gas exports via Soviet-era pipelines running through Ukraine to Europe were halted in the early hours of New Year's Day as a transit deal expired and warring Moscow and Kyiv have failed to reach an agreement to continue the flows.
articles.title: Russian gas exports to Europe via Ukraine halted as transit deal expires

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin, Eduardo Baptista
articles.description: The investigation into the crash of a South Korea passenger jet gathered pace on Wednesday as bereaved families began to prepare funerals after authorities finished formally identifying the 179 victims of the country's worst air disaster.
articles.title: South Korea crash investigation ramps up as funeral procedures begin

articles.author: Hyonhee Shin
articles.description: Senior aides to South Korea's impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol offered to resign en masse on Wednesday, a day after his office expressed regret over acting President Choi Sang-mok's approved of two new judges to a court set to decide Yoon's fate.
articles.title: South Korea's presidential aides offer to resign amid political crisis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli air strikes on al-Bureij refugee camp and Jabalia town in central and northern Gaza killed at least 17 Palestinians on Wednesday, the official Palestinian news agency WAFA reported.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill at least 17 Palestinians in Gaza, WAFA reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said late on Tuesday that no one would give peace to his country as a gift, but he believed the United States would stand alongside Kyiv as it fights to stop Russia's 34-month invasion.
articles.title: Zelenskiy says US will be alongside Ukraine's efforts to stop Russia

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maytaal Angel, Ali Sawafta
articles.description: Reuters spoke to four Palestinian men detained by Israel since the war’s outbreak. All were held for months, accused of affiliating with an illegal organisation, and released without being formally charged or convicted of any crime.
articles.title: Amid ceasefire push, Palestinians bear the scars of Israeli detention
